p: The species reviewed did not have significantly higher F ST values in the invasive compared to the native ranges (Additional file 8, paired Wilcoxon rank sum test, p = 0.052). Although small population sizes in newly introduced species could lead to an increase in the amount of inbreeding in a species, there was no significant difference in the inbreeding coefficients of the native and invasive ranges of species reported in the literature to be outbreeding (Additional file 8, paired Wilcoxon rank sum test, p = 0.651).
